intro: Xanthophyllum penibukanense, commonly known as the Penibukan goldenleaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange petals and velvety leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and requires specific soil conditions to thrive. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other small insects. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
